block.p: Margaret Green, who assists refugees, and Michael Rauenhorst, who helps provide loans to low-income entrepreneurs, were married yesterday. Msgr. Richard Albert performed the ceremony in the Lady Chapel at St. Patrick's Cathedral in New York. Archbishop Harry J. Flynn of St. Paul and Minneapolis took part in the ceremony.

The bride, 39, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the director of the refugee protection department at the International Rescue Committee in New York. She graduated from the University of Wisconsin and received a law degree from New York University. Her parents, Carol Green and Dr. Charles Green, live in Appleton, Wis., where the bride's father, a retired pediatrician, practiced at the LaSalle Clinic.

Margaret Green, who assists refugees, and Michael Rauenhorst, who helps provide loans to low-income entrepreneurs, were married yesterday. Msgr. Richard Albert performed the ceremony in the Lady Chapel at St. Patrick's Cathedral in New York. Archbishop Harry J. Flynn of St. Paul and Minneapolis took part in the ceremony.

The bride, 39, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the director of the refugee protection department at the International Rescue Committee in New York. She graduated from the University of Wisconsin and received a law degree from New York University. Her parents, Carol Green and Dr. Charles Green, live in Appleton, Wis., where the bride's father, a retired pediatrician, practiced at the LaSalle Clinic.

The bridegroom, 43, is a consultant to the Deutsche Bank Microcredit Development Fund, which provides loans through credit unions and nonprofit agencies around the world to low-income entrepreneurs. He graduated from the University of Notre Dame, received a law degree from the William Mitchell College of Law in St. Paul and holds an M.B.A. from Columbia.

He is a son of Henrietta and Gerald Rauenhorst of Naples, Fla. His father is the founder and former chief executive of the Opus Corporation, a commercial and industrial real estate development company in Minneapolis.
